comments.author: O. Bury

captions.text: Who was your favourite player growing up?

Obviously as a United fan it was Ryan Giggs.
Loved watching him play, ever since I was a little kid.
What's your most memorable moment for united?

My most memorable moment is when we won the
Champions league in 2008, it was a great night

for the club. Great night to be involved in,
and obviously to win the Champions League
is the highlight of my career.
Are you really 'Dat Guy'?

It's something you can't really explain, 'dat
guy'. Anyone can be 'dat guy' in certain situations.
Wazza was 'dat guy' the other day.
I'm lost here by the way.

It's just a bit of slang. Growing up in Manchester,
people are called 'dat guy', if you do something
you're 'dat guy', that's how it started.

What is the best goal you ever scored at Man
United.

I'd have to say my goal against Manchester
City, it was 1-1 and then ten minutes to go

I scored an overhead kick in the derby which
won us the game. It was definitely my best goal.
I agree.
What did you think when you saw that?

Obviously I know what Wazza can do, and I've
seen him do it before in training, and when

he did it in the game it was an unbelievable
moment. I'm a Manc through and through so
seeing it fly in I was just buzzing.

If you weren't a footballer what would you
be?

Difficult question, I'd be doing something
involved in sports. I'd probably would have

went to university after college I don't know.
What's so funny about that? Both my brothers

went to university, so I'll follow in their
footsteps.
But they're quite clever?
I think I'm the clever one.

What do you like most about playing for Manchester
United.

I think the history of the club, it's a massive
club and probably the biggest club in the

world and helping the team, helping the club
create history.

What's your favourite song to get you ready
for a big match?
What are you laughing at?

I think I know it but I don't think you can
say it live.

I know what he's thinking, but it depends
what kind of mood you're in. It's the DJ,

the DJ gets to pick the tunes but I'm easy
going. I listen to anything really.
Who is   the toughest defender you have faced?

I'd have to say John Terry is the toughest
defender I'd played against. He reads the

game really well, he's big, he's physical,
he's tough to play against so you know you're
in for a tough game when you play him.

What's your favourite thing to practice in
training?

Finishing, usually do that a lot with Wazza
and the other strikers at the club. It's just

knowing where you want to place the ball,
and not changing your mind last minute. It's
the most enjoyable part for a striker.
Who was your inspiration as a young lad?

My inspiration as a young lad was just loving
football, loved everything about it, loved

watching it, loved playing it, growing up
as a fan I went to all the games was a ball

boy for about three seasons, was a mascot.
So I always wanted to be involved in football

and be a professional footballer and thankfully,
that dream has happened for me.
What is the best goal you ever scored?

At old Trafford I scored and overhead kick
against City and ran to the corner.

No, I think my favorite goal I ever scored is my first
goal for Manchester United against Stoke in
the Premier League.

What is the best moment you've ever had at
Old Trafford?

Best moment, at Old Trafford, there's been
a few. Beating Arsenal 8-2 was up there, I'd

have to say my first game I signed and being
a Liverpool lad to sign for Manchester United

wasn't easy but to score a hattrick in my
debut in the Champions League was a night
I'll never forget.
Who is your best mate at United?

To be fair, there's a few different cliques,
but everyone gels together very well. I'd

say my closest is probably Tom Cleverley and
Ashley Young. I don't like Wayne.

title: Nike Football: Wayne Rooney and Danny Welbeck answer your questions
